page.title: 03Industry in Congleton
page.content: In{Congleton}there is a variety of industry. The textile industry was the traditional industry of{Congleton but as time progressed it has diminished and many old mills have closed. Berisfords Limited, established in 1858 is the largest remaining company. It manufactures a wide range of products, specializing in ribbons and woven labels. Other industries are based at factories on the town's three industrial estates at Buglawton, Eaton Bank and Radnor Park. They include Siemens, a modern electrical and electronics company which came to {Congleton}in 1971 and now employs about 600 people here. Other firms include central heating equipment, wholefoods and engineering. {Congleton}is continuing to grow as an industrial town.
